title: Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at 180 Degree Consulting (Copenhagen, Capital Region) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with two other applicants. Asked about motivation and past work experience. Then had to complete three small case questions with the other applicants. We were then sent to another room to have a one-on-one interview where they asked about how we handle group/teamwork.
Interview Questions: How do you motivate group members?

title: Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at 180 Degree Consulting (Copenhagen, Capital Region) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Motivation form, group interview, individual interview (to see if fit for leadership). 
The group interview has you speak a bit about yourself and solve some riddles as a team. Individual just ask you about showing leadership and the qualities that make you suitable.
Interview Questions: to solve a riddle about moving participants across a river in a boat

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at 180 Degree Consulting
Interview Descriptions: The interview was divided mainly into two parts. In the first half, the interviewer asked some personal questions and the second half was about case studies. The interview went smoothly and the duration was approximately 20min
Interview Questions:
For the personal questions, they were mainly about leadership roles, why 180DC, greatest achievements, biggest weaknesses.
For the case studies, the first question was a market sizing question. The second question is to propose an organization structure for an NGO and finally propose metrics to evaluate the performance of the NGO.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at 180 Degree Consulting (London, England) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Two round interview + CV + cover letter with motivations for applying, usually all required within the first few weeks of term.

First round interview is a fit interview with the leadership of your branch to analyse your motivations as a consultant.

Second round interview is a competency test, with both the leadership and project leads (mostly project leads)
Interview Questions: Why 180 Degrees Consulting?
